57
58template <typename T>
59Tagged<T> ForwardingAddress(Tagged<T> heap_obj) {
60 MapWord map_word = heap_obj->map_word(kRelaxedLoad);
61
62 if (map_word.IsForwardingAddress()) {
63 return Tagged<T>::cast(map_word.ToForwardingAddress(heap_obj));
64 } else if (Heap::InFromPage(heap_obj)) {
65 DCHECK(!v8_flags.minor_ms);
66 return Tagged<T>();
67 } else {
68 return heap_obj;
69 }
70}
71
72// static
73base::EnumSet<CodeFlushMode> Heap::GetCodeFlushMode(Isolate* isolate) {
74 if (isolate->disable_bytecode_flushing()) {
75 return base::EnumSet<CodeFlushMode>();
76 }
77
78 base::EnumSet<CodeFlushMode> code_flush_mode;
79 if (v8_flags.flush_bytecode) {
80 code_flush_mode.Add(CodeFlushMode::kFlushBytecode);
81 }
82
83 if (v8_flags.flush_baseline_code) {
84 code_flush_mode.Add(CodeFlushMode::kFlushBaselineCode);
85 }
86
87 if (v8_flags.stress_flush_code) {
88 // This is to check tests accidentally don't miss out on adding either flush
89 // bytecode or flush code along with stress flush code. stress_flush_code
90 // doesn't do anything if either one of them isn't enabled.
91 DCHECK(v8_flags.fuzzing || v8_flags.flush_baseline_code ||
92 v8_flags.flush_bytecode);
93 code_flush_mode.Add(CodeFlushMode::kStressFlushCode);
94 }
95
96 return code_flush_mode;
97}
98
99Isolate* Heap::isolate() const { return Isolate::FromHeap(this); }
100
101bool Heap::IsMainThread() const {
102 return isolate()->thread_id() == ThreadId::Current();
103}

105int64_t Heap::external_memory() { return external_memory_.total(); }

107int64_t Heap::update_external_memory(int64_t delta) {
108 return external_memory_.Update(delta);

111RootsTable& Heap::roots_table() { return isolate()->roots_table(); }
112
113#define ROOT_ACCESSOR(Type, name, CamelName) \
114 Tagged<Type> Heap::name() { \
115 return Tagged<Type>::cast( \
116 Tagged<Object>(roots_table()[RootIndex::k##CamelName])); \
117 }
118MUTABLE_ROOT_LIST(ROOT_ACCESSOR)
119#undef ROOT_ACCESSOR
120
121Tagged<FixedArray> Heap::single_character_string_table() {
122 return Tagged<FixedArray>::cast(
123 Tagged<Object>(roots_table()[RootIndex::kSingleCharacterStringTable]));
124}
125
126#define STATIC_ROOTS_FAILED_MSG \
127 "Read-only heap layout changed. Run `tools/dev/gen-static-roots.py` to " \
128 "update static-roots.h."
129#if V8_STATIC_ROOTS_BOOL
130// Check all read only roots are allocated where we expect it. Skip `Exception`
131// which changes during setup-heap-internal.
132#define DCHECK_STATIC_ROOT(obj, name) \
133 if constexpr (RootsTable::IsReadOnly(RootIndex::k##name) && \
134 RootIndex::k##name != RootIndex::kException) { \
135 DCHECK_WITH_MSG(V8HeapCompressionScheme::CompressObject(obj.ptr()) == \
136 StaticReadOnlyRootsPointerTable[static_cast<size_t>( \
137 RootIndex::k##name)], \
138 STATIC_ROOTS_FAILED_MSG); \
139 }
140#else
141#define DCHECK_STATIC_ROOT(obj, name)
142#endif
143
144#define ROOT_ACCESSOR(type, name, CamelName) \
145 void Heap::set_##name(Tagged<type> value) { \
146 /* The deserializer makes use of the fact that these common roots are */ \
147 /* never in new space and never on a page that is being compacted. */ \
148 DCHECK_IMPLIES(deserialization_complete(), \
149 !RootsTable::IsImmortalImmovable(RootIndex::k##CamelName)); \
150 if constexpr (RootsTable::IsImmortalImmovable(RootIndex::k##CamelName)) { \
151 /* Cast via object to avoid compile errors when trying to cast a Smi */ \
152 /* to HeapObject (these Smis will anyway be excluded by */ \
153 /* RootsTable::IsImmortalImmovable but this isn't enough for the*/ \
154 /* compiler, even with `if constexpr`)*/ \
155 DCHECK( \
156 IsImmovable(Tagged<HeapObject>::cast(Tagged<Object>::cast(value)))); \
157 } \
158 DCHECK_STATIC_ROOT(value, CamelName); \
159 roots_table()[RootIndex::k##CamelName] = value.ptr(); \
160 }
161ROOT_LIST(ROOT_ACCESSOR)
162#undef ROOT_ACCESSOR
163#undef CHECK_STATIC_ROOT
164#undef STATIC_ROOTS_FAILED_MSG
165
166void Heap::SetRootMaterializedObjects(Tagged<FixedArray> objects) {
167 roots_table()[RootIndex::kMaterializedObjects] = objects.ptr();
168}
169
170void Heap::SetRootScriptList(Tagged<Object> value) {
171 roots_table()[RootIndex::kScriptList] = value.ptr();
172}
173
174void Heap::SetMessageListeners(Tagged<ArrayList> value) {
175 roots_table()[RootIndex::kMessageListeners] = value.ptr();
176}
177
178void Heap::SetFunctionsMarkedForManualOptimization(Tagged<Object> hash_table) {
179 DCHECK(IsObjectHashTable(hash_table) || IsUndefined(hash_table, isolate()));
180 roots_table()[RootIndex::kFunctionsMarkedForManualOptimization] =
181 hash_table.ptr();
182}

184PagedSpace* Heap::paged_space(int idx) const {
185 DCHECK(idx == OLD_SPACE || idx == CODE_SPACE || idx == SHARED_SPACE ||
186 idx == TRUSTED_SPACE);
187 return static_cast<PagedSpace*>(space_[idx].get());
188}
189
190Space* Heap::space(int idx) const { return space_[idx].get(); }

192Address* Heap::NewSpaceAllocationTopAddress() {
193 return new_space_ || v8_flags.sticky_mark_bits
194 ? isolate()->isolate_data()->new_allocation_info_.top_address()
195 : nullptr;
196}
197
198Address* Heap::NewSpaceAllocationLimitAddress() {
199 return new_space_ || v8_flags.sticky_mark_bits
200 ? isolate()->isolate_data()->new_allocation_info_.limit_address()
201 : nullptr;
202}

204Address* Heap::OldSpaceAllocationTopAddress() {
205 return allocator()->old_space_allocator()->allocation_top_address();
206}
207
208Address* Heap::OldSpaceAllocationLimitAddress() {
209 return allocator()->old_space_allocator()->allocation_limit_address();
210}

212inline const base::AddressRegion& Heap::code_region() {
213#ifdef V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP
214 return tp_heap_->GetCodeRange();
215#else
216 static constexpr base::AddressRegion kEmptyRegion;
217 return code_range_ ? code_range_->reservation()->region() : kEmptyRegion;
218#endif
219}
220
221Address Heap::code_range_base() {
222 return code_range_ ? code_range_->base() : kNullAddress;
223}
224
225int Heap::MaxRegularHeapObjectSize(AllocationType allocation) {
226 if (!V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL &&
227 (allocation == AllocationType::kCode)) {
228 DCHECK_EQ(MemoryChunkLayout::MaxRegularCodeObjectSize(),
229 max_regular_code_object_size_);
230 return max_regular_code_object_size_;
231 }
232 return kMaxRegularHeapObjectSize;
233}
234
235AllocationResult Heap::AllocateRaw(int size_in_bytes, AllocationType type,
236 AllocationOrigin origin,
237 AllocationAlignment alignment) {
238 return heap_allocator_->AllocateRaw(size_in_bytes, type, origin, alignment);
239}
240
241Address Heap::AllocateRawOrFail(int size, AllocationType allocation,
242 AllocationOrigin origin,
243 AllocationAlignment alignment) {
244 return heap_allocator_
245 ->AllocateRawWith<HeapAllocator::kRetryOrFail>(size, allocation, origin,
246 alignment)
247 .address();
248}
249
250void Heap::RegisterExternalString(Tagged<String> string) {
251 DCHECK(IsExternalString(string));
252 DCHECK(!IsThinString(string));
253 external_string_table_.AddString(string);
254}
255
256void Heap::FinalizeExternalString(Tagged<String> string) {
257 DCHECK(IsExternalString(string));
258 Tagged<ExternalString> ext_string = Tagged<ExternalString>::cast(string);
259
260 if (!v8_flags.enable_third_party_heap) {
261 PageMetadata* page = PageMetadata::FromHeapObject(string);
262 page->DecrementExternalBackingStoreBytes(
263 ExternalBackingStoreType::kExternalString,
264 ext_string->ExternalPayloadSize());
265 }
266
267 ext_string->DisposeResource(isolate());
268}
269
270Address Heap::NewSpaceTop() {
271 return new_space_ || v8_flags.sticky_mark_bits
272 ? allocator()->new_space_allocator()->top()
273 : kNullAddress;
274}
275
276Address Heap::NewSpaceLimit() {
277 return new_space_ || v8_flags.sticky_mark_bits
278 ? allocator()->new_space_allocator()->limit()
279 : kNullAddress;
280}
281
282bool Heap::InYoungGeneration(Tagged<Object> object) {
283 DCHECK(!HasWeakHeapObjectTag(object));
284 return IsHeapObject(object) && InYoungGeneration(HeapObject::cast(object));
285}
286
287// static
288bool Heap::InYoungGeneration(Tagged<MaybeObject> object) {
289 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object;
290 return object.GetHeapObject(&heap_object) && InYoungGeneration(heap_object);
291}
292
293// static
294bool Heap::InYoungGeneration(Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object) {
295 if (V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL) return false;
296 if (v8_flags.sticky_mark_bits) {
297 return !MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(heap_object)
298 ->IsReadOnlyOrMajorMarkingOn() &&
299 !MarkBit::From(heap_object.address())
300 .template Get<AccessMode::ATOMIC>();
301 }
302 bool result = MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(heap_object)->InYoungGeneration();
303#ifdef DEBUG
304 // If in the young generation, then check we're either not in the middle of
305 // GC or the object is in to-space.
306 if (result) {
307 // If the object is in the young generation, then it's not in RO_SPACE so
308 // this is safe.
309 Heap* heap = Heap::FromWritableHeapObject(heap_object);
310 DCHECK_IMPLIES(heap->gc_state() == NOT_IN_GC, InToPage(heap_object));
311 }
312#endif
313 return result;
314}
315
316// static
317bool Heap::InFromPage(Tagged<Object> object) {
318 DCHECK(!HasWeakHeapObjectTag(object));
319 return IsHeapObject(object) && InFromPage(HeapObject::cast(object));
320}
321
322// static
323bool Heap::InFromPage(Tagged<MaybeObject> object) {
324 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object;
325 return object.GetHeapObject(&heap_object) && InFromPage(heap_object);
326}
327
328// static
329bool Heap::InFromPage(Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object) {
330 return MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(heap_object)->IsFromPage();
331}
332
333// static
334bool Heap::InToPage(Tagged<Object> object) {
335 DCHECK(!HasWeakHeapObjectTag(object));
336 return IsHeapObject(object) && InToPage(HeapObject::cast(object));
337}
338
339// static
340bool Heap::InToPage(Tagged<MaybeObject> object) {
341 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object;
342 return object.GetHeapObject(&heap_object) && InToPage(heap_object);
343}
344
345// static
346bool Heap::InToPage(Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object) {
347 return MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(heap_object)->IsToPage();
348}
349
350bool Heap::InOldSpace(Tagged<Object> object) {
351 if (V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL) {
352 return object.IsHeapObject() &&
353 third_party_heap::Heap::InOldSpace(object.ptr());
354 }
355 return old_space_->Contains(object) &&
356 (!v8_flags.sticky_mark_bits || !Heap::InYoungGeneration(object));
357}
358
359// static
360Heap* Heap::FromWritableHeapObject(Tagged<HeapObject> obj) {
361 if (V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL) {
362 return Heap::GetIsolateFromWritableObject(obj)->heap();
363 }
364 MemoryChunkMetadata* chunk = MemoryChunkMetadata::FromHeapObject(obj);
365 // RO_SPACE can be shared between heaps, so we can't use RO_SPACE objects to
366 // find a heap. The exception is when the ReadOnlySpace is writeable, during
367 // bootstrapping, so explicitly allow this case.
368 SLOW_DCHECK(chunk->IsWritable());
369 Heap* heap = chunk->heap();
370 SLOW_DCHECK(heap != nullptr);
371 return heap;
372}
373
374void Heap::CopyBlock(Address dst, Address src, int byte_size) {
375 DCHECK(IsAligned(byte_size, kTaggedSize));
376 CopyTagged(dst, src, static_cast<size_t>(byte_size / kTaggedSize));
377}
378
379bool Heap::IsPendingAllocationInternal(Tagged<HeapObject> object) {
380 DCHECK(deserialization_complete());
381
382 if (V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL) {
383 return tp_heap_->IsPendingAllocation(object);
384 }
385
386 MemoryChunk* chunk = MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(object);
387 if (chunk->InReadOnlySpace()) return false;
388
389 BaseSpace* base_space = chunk->Metadata()->owner();
390 Address addr = object.address();
391
392 switch (base_space->identity()) {
393 case NEW_SPACE: {
394 return allocator()->new_space_allocator()->IsPendingAllocation(addr);
395 }
396
397 case OLD_SPACE: {
398 return allocator()->old_space_allocator()->IsPendingAllocation(addr);
399 }
400
401 case CODE_SPACE: {
402 return allocator()->code_space_allocator()->IsPendingAllocation(addr);
403 }
404
405 case TRUSTED_SPACE: {
406 return allocator()->trusted_space_allocator()->IsPendingAllocation(addr);
407 }
408
409 case LO_SPACE:
410 case CODE_LO_SPACE:
411 case TRUSTED_LO_SPACE:
412 case NEW_LO_SPACE: {
413 LargeObjectSpace* large_space =
414 static_cast<LargeObjectSpace*>(base_space);
415 base::SharedMutexGuard<base::kShared> guard(
416 large_space->pending_allocation_mutex());
417 return addr == large_space->pending_object();
418 }
419
420 case SHARED_SPACE:
421 case SHARED_LO_SPACE:
422 case SHARED_TRUSTED_SPACE:
423 case SHARED_TRUSTED_LO_SPACE:
424 // TODO(v8:13267): Ensure that all shared space objects have a memory
425 // barrier after initialization.
426 return false;
427
428 case RO_SPACE:
429 UNREACHABLE();
430 }
431
432 UNREACHABLE();
433}
434
435bool Heap::IsPendingAllocation(Tagged<HeapObject> object) {
436 bool result = IsPendingAllocationInternal(object);
437 if (v8_flags.trace_pending_allocations && result) {
438 StdoutStream{} << "Pending allocation: " << std::hex << "0x" << object.ptr()
439 << "\n";
440 }
441 return result;
442}
443
444bool Heap::IsPendingAllocation(Tagged<Object> object) {
445 return IsHeapObject(object) && IsPendingAllocation(HeapObject::cast(object));
446}
447
448void Heap::ExternalStringTable::AddString(Tagged<String> string) {
449 base::Optional<base::MutexGuard> guard;
450
451 // With --shared-string-table client isolates may insert into the main
452 // isolate's table concurrently.
453 if (v8_flags.shared_string_table &&
454 heap_->isolate()->is_shared_space_isolate()) {
455 guard.emplace(&mutex_);
456 }
457
458 DCHECK(IsExternalString(string));
459 DCHECK(!Contains(string));
460
461 if (InYoungGeneration(string)) {
462 young_strings_.push_back(string);
463 } else {
464 old_strings_.push_back(string);
465 }
466}
467
468Tagged<Boolean> Heap::ToBoolean(bool condition) {
469 ReadOnlyRoots roots(this);
470 return roots.boolean_value(condition);
471}
472
473int Heap::NextScriptId() {
474 FullObjectSlot last_script_id_slot(&roots_table()[RootIndex::kLastScriptId]);
475 Tagged<Smi> last_id = Smi::cast(last_script_id_slot.Relaxed_Load());
476 Tagged<Smi> new_id, last_id_before_cas;
477 do {
478 if (last_id.value() == Smi::kMaxValue) {
479 static_assert(v8::UnboundScript::kNoScriptId == 0);
480 new_id = Smi::FromInt(1);
481 } else {
482 new_id = Smi::FromInt(last_id.value() + 1);
483 }
484
485 // CAS returns the old value on success, and the current value in the slot
486 // on failure. Therefore, we want to break if the returned value matches the
487 // old value (last_id), and keep looping (with the new last_id value) if it
488 // doesn't.
489 last_id_before_cas = last_id;
490 last_id =
491 Smi::cast(last_script_id_slot.Relaxed_CompareAndSwap(last_id, new_id));
492 } while (last_id != last_id_before_cas);
493
494 return new_id.value();
495}
496
497int Heap::NextDebuggingId() {
498 int last_id = last_debugging_id().value();
499 if (last_id == DebugInfo::DebuggingIdBits::kMax) {
500 last_id = DebugInfo::kNoDebuggingId;
501 }
502 last_id++;
503 set_last_debugging_id(Smi::FromInt(last_id));
504 return last_id;
505}
506
507int Heap::GetNextTemplateSerialNumber() {
508 int next_serial_number = next_template_serial_number().value();
509 set_next_template_serial_number(Smi::FromInt(next_serial_number + 1));
510 return next_serial_number;
511}
512
513int Heap::MaxNumberToStringCacheSize() const {
514 // Compute the size of the number string cache based on the max newspace size.
515 // The number string cache has a minimum size based on twice the initial cache
516 // size to ensure that it is bigger after being made 'full size'.
517 size_t number_string_cache_size = max_semi_space_size_ / 512;
518 number_string_cache_size =
519 std::max(static_cast<size_t>(kInitialNumberStringCacheSize * 2),
520 std::min(static_cast<size_t>(0x4000), number_string_cache_size));
521 // There is a string and a number per entry so the length is twice the number
522 // of entries.
523 return static_cast<int>(number_string_cache_size * 2);
524}
525
526void Heap::IncrementExternalBackingStoreBytes(ExternalBackingStoreType type,
527 size_t amount) {
528 base::CheckedIncrement(&backing_store_bytes_, static_cast<uint64_t>(amount),
529 std::memory_order_relaxed);
530 // TODO(mlippautz): Implement interrupt for global memory allocations that can
531 // trigger garbage collections.
532}
533
534void Heap::DecrementExternalBackingStoreBytes(ExternalBackingStoreType type,
535 size_t amount) {
536 base::CheckedDecrement(&backing_store_bytes_, static_cast<uint64_t>(amount),
537 std::memory_order_relaxed);
538}
539
540bool Heap::HasDirtyJSFinalizationRegistries() {
541 return !IsUndefined(dirty_js_finalization_registries_list(), isolate());
542}
543
544AlwaysAllocateScope::AlwaysAllocateScope(Heap* heap) : heap_(heap) {
545 heap_->always_allocate_scope_count_++;
546}
547
548AlwaysAllocateScope::~AlwaysAllocateScope() {
549 heap_->always_allocate_scope_count_--;
550}
551
552AlwaysAllocateScopeForTesting::AlwaysAllocateScopeForTesting(Heap* heap)
553 : scope_(heap) {}
554
555PagedNewSpace* Heap::paged_new_space() const {
556 return PagedNewSpace::From(new_space());
557}
558
559SemiSpaceNewSpace* Heap::semi_space_new_space() const {
560 return SemiSpaceNewSpace::From(new_space());
561}
562
563StickySpace* Heap::sticky_space() const {
564 DCHECK(v8_flags.sticky_mark_bits);
565 return StickySpace::From(old_space());
566}
567
568IgnoreLocalGCRequests::IgnoreLocalGCRequests(Heap* heap) : heap_(heap) {
569 heap_->ignore_local_gc_requests_depth_++;
570}
571
572IgnoreLocalGCRequests::~IgnoreLocalGCRequests() {
573 DCHECK_GT(heap_->ignore_local_gc_requests_depth_, 0);
574 heap_->ignore_local_gc_requests_depth_--;
575}
